regArea: Beck Lake, New Cody Reservoir, and Markham Reservoir in Park County
Big Horn Lake downstream from Highway 14A in Big Horn County
creel:
Trout- 5 per day or 10 in possession
Bass- 10 per day or 20 in possession
Walleye and Sauger- 6 per day or 12 in possession, no more than 3 can be Sauger
Channel Catfish- 6 per day or in possession
Burbot(ling)- 3 per day or in possession
Shovelnose Sturgeon- 3 per day or in possession
other: All walleye and sauger to be kept whole until off water and done fishing.

regArea: Bighorn and Wind River drainage lakes and streams in Big Horn, Fremont, Hot Springs, Park, and Washakie counties
other:
All walleye and sauger to be kept whole until off water and done fishing.
 One inch piece of skin to be left for species identification while in transit or in the field

regArea: A and M Reservoir in Sweetwater County

creel:
12 Walleye per day or in possession, regulations on Walleye taken by spear gun 
 not applicable
2 Trout per day or in posession. All Trout less than 16 inches to be released immediately

regArea: Bryan Stock Trail Pond In Natrona County
Crow Creek, Dale Creek, Horse Creek, Loedgepole Creek drainages on the Medicine Bow-Routt National Forest upstream from forest boundary in Albany County
creel: 6 Brook Trout per day or in possession
